newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen, JGBs rebound from lows, await Fed.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen, JGBs rebound from lows, await Fed.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen and Japanese government bond (JGB) futures rebounded from a sharp early sell-off on Monday as players covered their positions following a late plunge in Tokyo stocks.
"It was just some short-covering. The market had been oversold earlier," said a senior trader at an Asian institution.
He said players were likely to remain cautious ahead of Tuesday's Federal Open Market Committee meeting, which is widely expected to result in a 25 basis point hike in U.S. rates.
December Euroyen was quoted at 98.93 at 1115 GMT after falling as low as 98.82 against its IMM close at 98.94. Turnover was an active 32,300 lots.
June JGBs settled at 125.09 against their previous 125.49 after hitting a low of 124.62.
Dealers said the Bank of Japan (BOJ)'s neutral money market operation triggered heavy sales of Euroyen and JGB futures on fears of an impending change in Japan's monetary policy.
"The BOJ was expected to inject 200 billion yen in the money market but the actual injection was only 100 billion," said a dealer with a U.S. house.
He said the lower than expected injection had kept the overnight call loan rate well above the central bank's official discount rate of 0.50 percent.

"The BOJ may be trying to flatten out the yield curve a bit, hinting at their future policy. Instead of coming out and hiking rates in one sharp move, this would bring the short end of the curve up gradually," he said.
"I wouldn't expect the BOJ to tighten rates now even if the tankan comes out very well," the first trader said, referring to the BOJ's quarterly business sentiment survey due on April 2.
Eurodollar futures were glued within a one-tick band with most players choosing to stay flat ahead of the Fed meeting.
Dealers said the market was unlikely to react to a 25 basis point hike, but it could move sharply if the Fed left rates unchanged or raised them by 50 basis points.
September Eurodollars ended at 93.815 against their IMM close at 93.810 on light volume of 5,910 lots.
